snippet: LEAD: Voters in California this week needed to know a little bit about a lot of things - mountain lions, chiropractic and trial procedures, to name only a few. That made the measly 39.5 percent of the electorate who actually went to the polls part...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: Voters in California this week needed to know a little bit about a lot of things - mountain lions, chiropractic and trial procedures, to name only a few. That made the measly 39.5 percent of the electorate who actually went to the polls part of a dubious national trend - instant popular government.
